ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A lot of lab techniques and protocols. Great class if you want to learn the basic of labs.
I learned how to organize myself to work in a molecular bio lab, how to keep a lab notebook, and many basic lab techniques.
learning to formulate a research paper, reading primary literature, and organizing myself in the lab
I learned a lot of new lab skills and how to write a research report.
I learned various laboratory techniques, such as PCR, agarose gel electrophoresis, and CRISPR gRNA design. I also learned how to compose a research-style paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was a lot of work. Students are kind of just thrown into the midst of all the assignments and expected to either float by asking for hands-on help or just drown. I would've appreciated more opportunity to have learning that was paced for myself, rather than trying to keep up with all the due dates and deadlines, especially with the final lab report that is really really extensive.
It was great, I just wish some of the instructions had been clearer.

strengths: lots of engaging experiments and the big picture of the class was emphasized
weakness: a long 4 hour stretch can cause attention span to fluctuate & TAs tend to be very harsh with grading
The strengths were the techniques we were exposed to

Strengths: the TAs and professor were extremely helpful with regards to learning new techniques and thinking conceptually about our findings and why we were conducting certain experiments. We learned the importance of staying organized--keeping a well-maintained lab notebook makes writing a paper much easier. Weaknesses: sometimes it would have been helpful to have the thorough in-class explanations in-writing as well to reference later on.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you love lab work, then yes. However, make sure youre organized and do every assignment. Work isnt too much during the semester but at the end of the semester, you have to write an entire research paper and it is LONG.
Not unless you need an MCDB lab course, don't take it!!! You can definitely find other labs that fulfill your requirement too!!!

Yes, I thought this class was very helpful in showing me what working in a bio lab would be like. Even though Im not planning on pursuing molecular biology, I still feel like the diligence and care and paper writing skills were great.
yes! Professor Moreno is excellent and very invested in bettering her students for the real world. I learned so much for the real world.
I would because I think I learned a lot but I also found it very difficult and sometimes frustrating so I would let them know that
Yes, I would highly recommend this course to any student looking to learn molecular biology lab techniques and practice writing a research paper.
